results.title: This is not Beirut
results.brief_description: Experimental in its format, “This is not Beirut” is a wonderful documentary comprising of an eclectic mix of film footage from Hi-8, VHS and “found” film material shot and collected in Lebanon during 1992. Filmmaker Jayce Salloum took on the challenge of selecting from over 200 hours of film footage to produce a unique and intriguing piece of film journalism which focuses mainly on Beirut, a city sometimes called the “City of eternity”, “Jewel of the Levant”, or “Window on the West” or conversely the “City in crisis”, “City of fear”, or “Improbable city”. By putting together a montage of these images Salloum provides an insight into Beirut and Lebanon, the constant reconstruction, structually and mentally, from years of bombings, kidnappings, killings, internal warfare, terrorists, resistance movements, and Israeli aggression and invasion. Enhancing this constantly changing stream of images is a soundtrack of interviews, conversations and commentary, television and radio broadcasts, street noises, music and even the occasional silent piece of footage. Salloum attempts to represent Lebanon and the Lebanese people as they see themselves and not necessarily as the West sees them, a concept which proves to be more difficult and problematical than expected. Historically interesting and a most enlightening documentary.

results.title: This Is Not a Film
results.brief_description: Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi makes a video diary with his phone in response to his government’s threats against him.

constellations_other.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_other.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.

results.description: Renowned Iranian director Jafar Panahi received a 6-year prison sentence and a 20-year ban from filmmaking and conducting interviews with foreign press due to his open support for the opposition party in Iran’s 2009 election. In this film, which was shot secretly on an iPhone by Panahi’s close friend Mojtaba Mirtahmasb and smuggled into France on a USB stick concealed inside a cake for a last-minute submission to Cannes, Panahi documents his daily life under house arrest as he awaits a decision on his appeal.
description_for_label: Renowned Iranian director Jafar Panahi received a 6-year prison sentence and a 20-year ban from filmmaking and conducting interviews with foreign press due to his open support for the opposition party in Iran’s 2009 election. In this film, which was shot secretly on an iPhone by Panahi’s close friend Mojtaba Mirtahmasb and smuggled into France on a USB stick concealed inside a cake for a last-minute submission to Cannes, Panahi documents his daily life under house arrest as he awaits a decision on his appeal.

results.title: This is no time for romance
results.creator_credit: Fernand Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Idle hours at a summer cottage, when her husband is at work and the children busy at play, give a wife time to dream a little and reflect on her life and her marriage. Is it enough? What else might she have made of herself? But then her husband returns and she opts for things as they are. A relaxed drama that has much of the mood of a summer outdoors. Cast includes Marc Favreau and Monique Mercure. (Awards: Tours; Toronto.)

results.title: This is New York
results.creator_credit: M. Sasek, Morton Schindel, Sonny Fox and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: New York City from a child’s viewpoint. A French boy and his papa visit New York, and the wide-eyed boy describes what he sees and tells some of the facts he has learned about the city. Adapted from Miroslav Sasek’s book ‘This is New York’ for children.

results.title: This is my world
results.brief_description: Leanne is a virtual popstar. The artist dressed as the character Leanne (modeled on an anime character) sings a sorrowful pop song about her lonely world. The video is shot in the liminal no-place space of the Shopping Centre.

results.title: This is my thing
results.brief_description:
Diner’s Club is for people with disabilities and where once a month, for Melanie, it provides a sense of independence and a chance to mix within her own social group. She explains some of the problems that arise when people with disabilities attempt to organise a night out for dinner.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: This is my home
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Care and accommodation for the elderly in Victoria; shows the variety of specially planned homes available - individual houses with gardens in selectged areas; units of ten self-contained flats; flatettes with a community lounge; large homes with a matron presiding; small hospitals where patients are encouraged to walk again. Also stresses the importance of practising handicrafts, hobbies and gardening and being generally active.

results.title: This is Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the creatures that stir in the hills, forests and hall of Mt Best. The people of Mt Best are a special breed, with their Secret Men’s and Women’s Business and their legend of the Bocce Bird. This is a town that consists of a solitary hall but is a constant, thriving hive of activity. Combined with the breathtaking views, Mt Best is a place of mystery, beauty and laughter.
